derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French disme, from Latin decima pars 'tenth part'. The word originally denoted a tithe or tenth part; the modern sense 'ten cent coin' dates from the late 18th cent

encyclopedia.content: 美加一角硬币 【单词】dime 【音标】英音：[daim] ；美音：[daΙm] 【词性】名词 【例句】Ten dimes make one dollar （十个一角为一元。） 【解释】美国和加拿大的一角（十分）硬币。 【举例】 1. Can you give me a dime for two nickels? 你能不能用两个五分镍币给我换一个一毛的镍币？ 2. The car can turn on a dime. 这车能在极小的地方转弯。 3. A dime is equivalent to ten pennies. 一角等于十分。 4. The liberty torc

entry.def: A dime is an American coin worth ten cents.

means.word_mean: 1. a United States coin worth one tenth of a dollar
